abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is considered
            satisfactory. The project sustainability is substantial,
            considering both the government and the private
            sector's interest in the future of the project. Some
            key lessons learned and recommendations follow: 1) important
            factors for project sustainability are the linkages among
            the private industry, the government and public entities, as
            well as coordination with the respective ministry, i.e., for
            the provision or access to facilities, equipment, human
            resources and technical expertise; 2) an institutional
            framework should be in place to ease national policies and
            delineate areas of responsibility; 3) decision making,
            flexibility and creativity are paramount areas in the
            vitality of a successful operation, and a constant
            institutional strengthening provides the likelihood for
            sustainable projects; 4) selection of courses, responding to
            client and industry demands may be better obtained through a
            timely and accurate labor market information; 5) flexibility
            in the cycle schedule and training modules facilitated the
            movement from level to level; 6) evidence suggests that the
            Career Enhancement Program was vital for a successful
            operation, and it should be strengthened in future
            operations; and, 7) the Microenterprise Development Program
            however, hindered success, thus substantial time should be
            allowed for such programs to take off.
